            ADJUSTMENT CREDIT - PHASE II,TF021297-KYRGYZ - SOCIAL SECTOR
            ADJUSTMENT CREDIT,TF021296-KYRGYZ-SOCIAL SECTOR ADJUSTMENT CREDIT,TF021174-KYRGYZ REPUBLIC-SOCIAL SECTOR
            ADJUSTMENT CREDIT,TF027113-PHRD-SOCIAL SECTOR ADJUSTMENT CREDIT

abstracts.cdata!:
The Social Sector Adjustment Credit
            Project seeks to: 1) establish a fiscally sustainable
            pension scheme that will provide a stronger linkage between
            contributions and benefits, while providing a minimum level
            of guaranteed support to prevent poverty; 2) improve the
            effectiveness of labor market interventions under conditions
            of high unemployment; and 3) implement well-targeted and
            fiscally sustainable programs to alleviate poverty. The
            credit will be released in two tranches. If successfully
            implemented, the program is expected to result in reductions
            in the payroll contribution rate, alleviating the
            significant burden on enterprises and on employment, and
            opening the way for a transition to a partially funded
            system. The primary risk of the project is that policy
            reversals could undermine the medium term fiscal
            sustainability of the pension system. Other risks include
            lower than expected collections and weak institutional
            capacity within the Social Fund. To mitigate this risk, the
            Social Fund is undertaking an aggressive contributor
            registration drive and has agreed on a comprehensive plan of
            coordination with the Tax Inspectorate.
